FXUS04 KWBC 020627
QPFPFD
 
QUANTITATIVE PRECIPITATION FORECAST DISCUSSION
NWS HYDROMETEOROLOGICAL PREDICTION CENTER CAMP SPRINGS MD
226 AM EDT SUN MAY 02 2004
 
PRELIM DAY 1 AND DAY 2 QPF DISCUSSION
VALID MAY 03/1200 UTC THRU MAY 04/1200 UTC
REFERENCE AWIPS GRAPHICS UNDER...PRECIP ACCUM - 24HR
 
ERN U.S...
WAVY FRONTAL BNDRY AHEAD OF AMPLIFYING MID LEVEL TROF OVER THE
GT LAKES AND MID MS VALLEY WILL BE THE MAJOR FOCUS FOR PCPN ON DAY
1.   MODELS HAVE SHOWN REMARKABLE CONTINUITY AT 5H WITH THE
EVOLUTION OF THE UPR TROF THRU THE GT LAKES AS WELL AS STG VORT
AND
ASSOCD JET STREAK FCST TO DRIVE SEWD ACRS MO...BUT SEEM TO BE
MISSING
SOME OF THE SMALL SCALE DETAILS.    ONE SFC WAVE IS EXPECTED TO
LIFT
NEWD EARLY DAY 1 ACRS WRN NY WITH A BAND OF MDT RAINS ASSOCD WITH
PD OF WARM ADV AND FAVORABLE RT ENTRANCE JET SUPPORT.  SECONDARY
VORT DROPPING THRU THE MID MS VALLEY WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY GOOD
COLD POOL WHICH SHOULD HELP TO DESTABILIZE ATMOS UNDERNEATH IT IN
THE AFTN FOR RISK OF SHWRS AND PSBL TSTMS.  WHILE MSTR WILL BE
LIMITED..STG INSTABILITY AND MID LEVEL FORCING COULD SQUEEZE OUT
SOME SPOTTY .50 INCH AMOUNTS WITH ETA AND GFS IN AGREEMENT. 
MEANWHILE FARTHER EAST..CONTINUED BACKING UPR FLOW AND FAVORABLE
RT ENTRANCE JET DYNAMICS OF 130 KT UPR JET SHOULD RESULT IN
INCREASING CNVTN ALONG AND IN ADVANCE OF COLD FRONT PUSHING ACRS
THE ERN TN VALLEY AND SE STATES AND TOWARD THE MID ATLC. 
TIMINGWISE..MODELS HAVE BEEN TOO SLOW WITH SQLN ACTIVITY PUSHING
ACRS THE GULF COAST REGION AND GIVEN RECENT RADAR TRENDS BLV THE
ETA IS BETTER AT HANDLING THE FASTER MOVEMENT THOUGH LIKELY
UNDERDONE WITH AMOUNTS.   WITH PWS IN THE 1.5 TO 1.75 INCH RANGE
FEEDING IN AHEAD OF THE APCHG FNT AND PREFRONTAL SQLN POTNL WILL
EXIST FOR BROAD AREA OF 1 TO 1.5 INCH PLUS RAINS FROM ERN SECTIONS
OF
THE FL PANHANDLE NEWD INTO THE MID ATLC REGION.


DAY 2...

...ERN CONUS...
CDFNT ALG THE ERN SEABOARD ERLY IN THE PD WILL MOV OFFSHORE BY
60 HRS.  IT WILL LINGER ACRS NEW ENG AND FL.  A SECONDARY SFC LOW
IS FCST TO FORM IN SRN NEW ENG AND MOV NEWD IN SRN CAN.  H5 TROF
OVER THE OH AND TN VLYS WILL MOV NEWD AND BE CENTERED OVER
NEW ENG BY THE END OF DAY 2.  STRONG S/WV IN THE LWR MS VLY IS
PROGGED TO MOV TO THE MID-ATLC AND NEW ENG.  AS TROF MOVS NEWD
HGTS RISE ACRS THE SERN CONUS AND MID-ATLC.  ETA IS A BIT SLOWER
THAN THE GFS THIS CYCLE.  UKMET IS THE FASTEST SOLN...AS IT HAS
BEEN FOR THE PAST FEW DAYS.  CAN SOLN IS SOMEWHERE IN THE
MIDDLE.  

THERE IS SOME STRONG UVV ACRS THE CSTL CAROLINAS AND NEW ENG
DURG THE PD AND DECENT UPR DYNAMICS...WITH 130 KT JET E OF THE
ADVANCING TROF...OVER THE MID ATLC AND NEW ENG.  STRONG SLY H8
FLOW ERLY ON...AOA 50 KTS...WILL KEEP ABUNDANT MOISTURE OVER THE
EXTREME CSTL SECTIONS OF THE ERN CONUS.  PW VALUES ARE AOA 1.50
INCHES IN THESE AREAS AND THERE IS A TIGHT GRADIENT TO THE W.  PW
VALUES DROP TO 0.50 INCHES OR LESS NOT TOO FAR TO THE W.  

MDL QPF VALUES ARE IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT AND ANY DIFFS CAN
BE RESOLVED THRU A MDL BLEND.

ELSEWHERE...GENLY LIGHT QPF ACRS THE GRTLKS AREA AND NRN PLAINS
AS A WK CDFNT EXTENDS SWD FROM A LOW IN CNTRL CAN.  GFS IS MORE
AGGRESSIVE WITH S/WV ENERGY DROPPING SEWD FROM CAN AS
WELL...AND MAY BE HAVING SOME FEEDBACK PROBS.  MOISTURE IS
LIMITED WITH PW VALUES AOB 0.75 INCHES.  

IN THE PAC NW...LARGE LOW APPROACHING WRN CAN/PAC NW.  THERE
ARE MINOR S/WV DETAIL DIFFS.  UPR JET DYNAMICS INCREASE DURG THE
PD WITH 90 KT WIND MAX MOVG INTO WA.  SWLY ONSHORE FLOW
INCREASES...BUT IS NOT ALL THAT STRONG DURG THE PD AND PW
INCREASES TO 0.75 TO 1.00 INCH.  AGAIN...ANY QPF DIFFS BETWEEN THE
MDLS COULD BE RESOLVED USING A BLEND...AMTS ARE GENLY LIGHT.


SULLIVAN/NIERENBERG

GRAPHICS AVAILABLE ON THE WEB AT WWW.HPC.NCEP.NOAA.GOV
